Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: shackelton
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to paris, and the best hotel yet. It's in a great location for shopping, eating and museums. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CesmeTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in and around Saint Germain des Pres many times over the years but this time we decided to look for an hotel through booking.com and were offered Au Manoir at a price lower than our usual haunt, so thought we'd give it a try. And we were very pleased we did! There is a car park virtually beneath the hotel (although there is no concession for short stays) which is very convenient and the hotel itself is actually on Boulevard Saint Germain - next door to Cafe Lipp, across the road from Le DeuxMagots and Cafe de Flore. Not that we used any of these restaurants, as there are so many to choose from! And there is a Monoprix supermarket just around the corner! The room was very interesting - long and thin and divided into three sections, but very comfortable, if a little warm (the air conditioning is not available in the winter) and had great accommodation. We shall probably be back, later in the year!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel on St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: OxfordAJR
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel in a fantastic location. If you are visiting Paris and don't plan to spend a ton of time in your room, then this hotel is ideal! It's very well located amongst the shops and restaurants of St Germain des Pres. I can't find fault in it. The rooms were spacious (for Paris), immaculate, and quiet. The breakfast is well worth the price. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel in a great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: betona
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Au Manoir on Valentine's day based on Trip Advisor reviews and the location so far as we could tell from maps. It turned out to be a perfect spot for a romantic getaway. This is a very small boutique hotel where every room is different. We had a deluxe on the 1st floor (which is the 2nd floor to Americans) and enjoyed the room and its amenities. The bathroom was quite large for Europe standards and had an overhead shower. We loved the towel warmer as well. And the room was very quiet. The free wifi was decent, running around 5Mbps down/1Mbps up and easy to connect to. The staff never steered us wrong on dining recommendations and were happy to converse in English. There are ATM's just a few steps in either direction outside and the Metro stop is basically across the street. The hotel is easily within walking distance of the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay and Notre Dame. Also walk in literally any direction and you'll enjoy window shopping and a never-ending selection of cafes. The location is fantastic. Sweet tooth Tip #1: Get a Nutella crepe across the street in the street vendor's stand (open late). Sweet tooth Tip #1: Great chocolate store across Boulevard Saint Germain and down about a block to the east.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: newmexone
Reviews.Content: Some friends had recommended this hotel and it turned out to be a great recommendation. The hotel is perfectly located especially if you like to walk as it was within walking distance for us of the Louvre, the Orsay, the Pompidou Center and Notre Dame. The rooms while small as is usual for Paris have updated bathrooms. It was a little tricky using the shower as it was not a fully enclosed tub so it was difficult to avoid getting water on the floor. However, the heated towel rack was fantastic. We loved the fact that the rooms came furnished with robes and slippers. If you like firm beds this is the hotel for you. I would have prefered a bit more give in the mattress, but that is such a matter of individual taste that 50% will like it and 50% will dislike it. Breakfast was included (although we learned for bookings after December 2011) breakfast would cost 14 Euros. If it had not been included we would have definitely eaten elsewhere. It is your typical hotel breakfast - cheese, bread, coffee, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt and pastry. It was fine, but if you are paying my advice would be to go to a nearby cafe. The gentleman at the front desk, Aziz, was very helpful. He arranged for us to purchase our museum passes at a nearby Best Western and was always pointing us in the right direction for our excursions. The young man who was on the desk when we checked out was not as helpful. As we were handing in our key, he asked if we would like to pay. We told him we had pre-paid, but he could find no record of it. He ended up calling Aziz who helped straighten out the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location in the heart of Paris on the Boulevard Saint Germain which has many shops and restaurants along it - similar to that of Oxford Street. About a 20 min walk to Eiffel Tower/Champs Elysee and a 10 min walk to Notre Dame/Louvre. Hotel staff are extremely helpful and speak very good English. The room was situated over-looking the boulevard. Was a tiny bit smaller than expected but was decorated in an old-fashioned French style that didn't make it feel like a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: loobielulu12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel via a euro star deal for 1 night including return travel for £300. I have stayed in Paris before in the saint michaels district which was nice however this hotel was just wonderful my only regret is that we were not staying for longer. When we first arrived we got the metro from gare de nord to saint germain de pre and were pleasantly surprised to find the hotel almost opposite the exit of the metro station. The hotel itself was very chic with a very friendly English speaking receptionist who put us in room 502 facing to the front with lovely views overlooking the city. The room was outstanding with fabric walls and an ornate decor huge bed chests for our bags and a fabulous bathroom I almost didn't want to leave it. Saint germain de pre is very central we decided to walk to the Eiffel tower which took us about 40minutes but was very straight forward and enabled us to see some other amazing buildings on our journey. On the way back we decided to grab a bike from one of the many bike stations dotted around the city this cost €1.70 although you will need a debit/credit card for the machine as it will pre authorise a deposit in case you don't return the bike. Every where is flat in Paris so riding a bike was a breeze and there are loads of bike stations to drop it off at when you are finished one just outside the hotel infact. Lastly we went to le petit zinc in the evening opposite the hotel for dinner it was lovely and very reasonably priced I have left a review on there to save waffling on anymore here. This hotel is a must for any traveller well worth a stay I cannot see how you would be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: melchior1
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay two nights at this hotel but due to an all-out strike in Belgium affecting all public transport we stayed two extra nights. This was no problem and we were able to stay in the room we had been given. The room was very comfortable and had tea and coffeemaking facilities as well as a mini bar and is extremely quiet considering the busy location! The hotel's decor is very charming and cosy, breakfast was excellent, location is fantastic being close to St Germain des Pres and opposite the famous cafes Les Deux Magots and Cafe de Flore as well as the metro station. We were lucky enough to be there before Christmas so there were Christmas markets everywhere and the atmosphere was great. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Bewdy No Problems”
Reviews.Author: bulldogsfight
Reviews.Content: Excellent location large room nice bathroom stayed with wife and adult daughter

Reviews.Title: “Mother/daughter week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mrsboomer
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous location for a two women traveling together. My adult daughter and I never used the metro as everything was in walking distance - great restaurants,museums, Churches and shopping. The hotel was ideally located and our room overlooking the Boulevard was surprising quiet. Although small the room was comfortable with a lovely breakfast room and a perfect breakfast. I am hoping to return with my sister next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff”
Reviews.Author: JKHEBoston
Reviews.Content: This small hotel had an excellent location for exploring Paris - and getting in and out of the city from the airport and train stations. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room we had was pretty spacious (unlike the elevator) with a lovely updated bathroom. The breakfast was as expected for a Parisian tourist hotel. Again, the location was perfect for us and we would return. The wifi worked well. We had an inside room with an opening window to the interior courtyard area and was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch in all respects”
Reviews.Author: kaeru2915
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. It is in a fantastic location - within 20 minutes walking of the major attractions of central Paris. It also has four very good cafes right outside it's door and several others within a block. I thought the best part was the staff. They couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. I had the front desk people phone to confirm some tour reservations as I'm not fluent in French. They were more than happy to do this. The room was very nice with more room than we expected. The breakfast was of the highest quality and had a nice variety of things to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Maralyn C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a very good location with losts of restaurants close by and very convenient for the Hop on, hop off bus and also the Metro. Many local shops close by to explore. Although the room was small it was very comfortable and very nicely decorated. It was lovely to be able to look out of the window and see the boulevard and many local restaurants. The staff were very helpful with questions and directions which made our stay very enjoyable. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “favourite hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: meralbg
Reviews.Content: Our favourite hotel in paris, Au Manoir is a gorgeous boutique hotel in an unbeatable location on the Rive Gauche. The rooms are a nice size, clean and comfortable. It's next door to Brasserie Lipp, and across the street from Cafe de Flore and Cafe Deux Maggots! Wining and dining and shopping in the area are simply fabulous, everything else - museums, monuments, cinemas - are within easy reach, breakfast is plentiful, staff is very helpful and pleasant. Au Manoir has never disappointed us!

Reviews.Title: “French and quaint”
Reviews.Author: BarryJ_100
Reviews.Content: 2 minutes to the metro, says it all and surrounded by popular typical French restaurants ( such as Lipp and cafe Le Florence.) It's small and the complimentary breakfast is well looked after and clean. Bathrooms are incredibly small and the ( superior ) room was pretty small too. But great location ,but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more”
Reviews.Author: mawsie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location and it turned out to be everything we needed and more. After reading all the reviews we chose it and were very pleased. The staff, cleanliness, breakfasts, bedding were all excellent. There is a in house computer to use if you have not brought your own and great for checking emails or printing your airline boarding pass. We would highly recommend to our friends. There is a lot of choice out there so it is important to set yourself apart and this hotel is super. We used the limousine they recommend to get to the airport and it was great as well. We took the train in from the airport and vowed not to do that again. That's the second time we have done it and with luggage it can be very cramped and uncomfortable. Each time more people come on the train, you think it can't get anymore crowded but it does!. For the difference in money it is just not worth it.Anyways great hotel, great location, great personel. Helpful when they must be asked the same questions time and time again!!!!!! You would never know it from their pleasant manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_SM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in our honeymoon. I had booked it in advance and got a very good fare. The location is excelent, in the elegant Boulevard Saint Germain. It is close to a subway station, which provides easy access to every part of the city. Nice breakfast and friendly staff. Drawbacks: (i) the wi-fi did not cover the entire room; (ii) the room is quite small (very common in Paris). Tip: get one of the deluxe rooms. They face the beautiful boulevard and are a bit bigger. The difference in the fare is very low.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SALfamily
Reviews.Content: Staff were courteous and very helpful. Breakfast was delicious and elegantly presented. Rooms were spacious, clean, and luxurious. Couldn't ask for a better location. Within easy walking distance of numerous restaurants and attractions, and the serene and beautiful Luxembourg gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Diane D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 8 days and at the end of the day the hotel was a perfect "homecoming". We started the day with a great included breakfast with choices of cheese, sliced meat, yogurt, boiled egg, baked goods including croissants and baguettes, fresh fruit, mixed fruit bowl, great coffee, and lovely jams/jellies.Our room overlooked the Boulevard with Cafe Flores and Cafe Deux Magot across the street as well as a view of the St. Germaine de Pres Church. The metro was just across the street, very convenient. Restaurants abounded both north and south of the hotel and Brasserie Lipp is just next door. If you like steak go to Relais Entrecote. The Laduree macaroons shop is a very short walk north. Just a perfect location, great staff and a cozy yet very efficient room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vivien04
Reviews.Content: We have visited Paris many times and stayed in a variety of hotels but now we have found Au Manoir St Germain de Pres we will not look for another place to stay. It's position is great, the hotel is full of character, scrupulously clean, with an excellent breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: Marilynn_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room and the first night was configured with a long narrow entrance area with a single bed and the bedroom with a queen bed. Since we had booked with a king bed we requested to move which they did the following 3 nights. The rooms had recently been remolded and were very comfortable, including great a/c. The included breakfast was limited but fresh and nice friendly staff. Front reception was very knowledgeable on restaurant recommendations within walking distance as well as bus information to different areas. This area is very fun and offers alot of shopping, cafes, bistros and just people watching. We would recommend this hotel to others considering a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BandKRitz
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and decided to stay in the Saint Germain De Pres area which led us to the Au Manoir. Was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and the updated modern bathroom! Our room had large windows that opened, but we were on the 2nd floor and our view was the back side of the hotel. Late at night and early in the morning there was outside noise from garbage cans being used, but we did sleep with our window open as the temperature was pleasant. The location is perfect for high end shopping and dining. Within walking/bike riding distance to museums and sight seeing. Metro is less than a block away, bike station about one block away - very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, we will be back BUT......”
Reviews.Author: Pari8
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quaint hotel. The St Germain de Pres area beautiful to walk through. Lovely breakfast room. Our only complaint was initial older gentleman at reception- very unfriendly, not even a greeting when he sees you. Blondine, a lovely member of staff, who fixed my airconditioning was great. The younger gentleman at reception on our departure was very kind and courteous. Hotel staff should have a standard code of conduct- foreigners should be treated with utmost respect as we have chosen your country to holiday in. All in all lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “It is still a Best Western!”
Reviews.Author: lekingjd
Reviews.Content: I read all of these reviews and spent the extra to book based on the reviews. It is still a Best Western even if they put Premier in front of it. It is missing the charm of the local Parisian Hotels. It still smells of the smoke that used to exist in the rooms. The beds were comfortable and large, but we got rooked on the room rates because we had 4 people and through booking.com I put that in the system, but when I looked a the reservation it was for 3 persons maximum. So at the last minute I got rooked on having to rent another room. Spending more on this one night's hotel than on 3 nights in Venice. It was terrible. I would rather stay in a small quaint French hotel next time. I suggest you know what you are in for.

Reviews.Title: “Typical french hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and would return (if we got a discount rate). Typical european hotel (don't let the "best western" name confuse you) with stacked floors and tiny elevator (as a family, several of us would walk up/down the stairs). Front desk staff helped us with dinner reservations, taxis, etc. Breakfast buffet (included in our price) was typically french with sliced meats, cheeses, cereals, breads, hard boiled eggs, juices and good coffee - not as complete as an English breakfast, but this is Paris. Busy St. Germain just outside your door but our rooms on upper floors were quiet enough. Several good low-cost restaurants within walking distance. Short walks to Musee d'Orsee, Louvre, Notre Dame, Luxembourg, etc. Discount rates are available if you book in advance, but we paid close to full tariff, making this a lower value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JGuy4804
Reviews.Content: Our one night stay here was great. The staff was very helpful, the room was very comfortable, the breakfast was tasty, and the St. Germain neighborhood was very fun to walk around and explore. There are several world-famous cafes within a few blocks of the hotel. The Eiffel tower was pretty far away but the Louvre and Notre Dame were easily within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: corky978
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, Libania was helpful in every regard, front row tickets to concerts, great suggestions and always with a wonderful smile. We overlooked St germain which is busy but the room was quiet with windows closed. We chose a deluxe rm and were happy with size, bed and ammenities. Great location, loved "la Petit Zinc" nearby as well as bistro Henri on a delightful quaint rue nearby. The grocery store on the lower level of monoprix around the corner has everything you need for a picnic at luxemborg park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff, in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pudai
Reviews.Content: My better half had checked out the St. Germain de Pres area on a previous Paris trip so we knew where in Paris we wanted to stay. We booked this hotel for a 9 night stay right at the beginning of May with help from reviews on Trip Advisor and checking out the area via Google Earth. We booked a "Deluxe" grade room and requested an upper floor, non-smoking room. On arrival, Aziz at the front desk helpfully advised us that non-smoking rooms were limited and smaller. So we tried the "smoking" room (402) with our desired criteria at Aziz' suggestion and it was perfect. Not a hint of smoke smell in the immaculate room. As others have noted, rooms are on the small side, but there was plenty of storage for the contents of our large suitcases. The bathroom area was a bit odd, since the room door opens into the sink / tub / shower area. But the toilet is in a separate space with door and a sliding pocket door closed off the bath area from the bedroom/sitting area, so it worked out fine. Tub had hand and overhead shower heads, which were very convenient. Room AC was on and worked very well. So did the free wireless Internet. Although the hotel was fully booked, we heard not a peep from our neighbors either beside or above us. The clientele here is older and quiet. So if you want to party, go somewhere else! The Saint Germain De Pres area is in the heart of the action. Plenty of shopping, cafes, restaurants right near the hotel and within a few blocks. Even with the three famous cafes next door and across the wide boulevard, nighttime noise was minimal and no problem whatsoever. Everything in Paris is expensive and you can certainly find cheaper places to stay. But for the money and especially the location, we don't think you'll find a better spot! Special thanks to Aziz and Libania of the front desk and Rosaline who worked hard to keep everyone happy during breakfast for making our stay a pleasure. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere at a price”
Reviews.Author: SHADDACalifornia
Reviews.Content: $350 per for a small garret room facing a VERY busy street (all day and all night). Very hot - no AC. Begged for a move away from the front, and all that was available (doubtful) was a triple for a whopping $425 per. This inner courtyard room funneled all the noise upwards - at 5:30AM (!) when the kitchen help from the various restaurants which ring the courtyard arrive for work. Au Manoir is however extremely centrally located in the heart of the Latin Quarter. But the food, venues, clothing prices are not for a students' budget. This was our third trip to Paris and the best bargain this time, as in the past, was the beloved Metro!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: traveller5919
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Great location. Metro right across the street. But, you can walk to everything, with good shoes! We did alot of walking to enjoy the sights. Had fantastic weather Easter weekend. Can't find anything wrong with this hotel. Would definetely recommend it. Loved Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: zann44
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel, good value. Convenient location, close to trains, subway and buses. Helpful staff, terrific restaurants in the neighborhood. Delicious breakfast every morning and courteous staff. Within walking distance of literally everything in central Paris... we would go back in a minute! The hotel is located amidst many great spots for Parisian cafe-sitting... and in the heart of the university district so there is a very youthful vibe to the neighborhood. Try the crepe stand across the street.. you will return many times!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Town!”
Reviews.Author: Bijouxmama
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about my travel to Paris since I had never travelled to Europe and didn't know what to expect. But not only did I fall in love with Paris this hotel was the perfect location for everything I wanted to do. It was in the heart of St. Germain, steps from a taxi stand and metro station. I walked EVERYWHERE! I was amazed by the amount of cafe's and shops so close to the hotel. The hotel was very nice and clean. Breakfast was limited in selection but very good and fresh. The front desk staff was super nice (especially the Portugese woman who works during the day. Our biggest compalint about the room is the heating and air. Our A/C was not turned on, I suppose because it's not usually 70 degrees in March. But... since our room was so hot we had to sleep with the window open and someone on the ground starts banging on trash cans at 5am. After a few nights I just started taking sleeping pills then I could get some sleep. At the end of the day I really liked the hotel and I would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, excellent location, can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: cayenne712
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel. The rooms are clean and slightly larger than the normal Paris/France hotel room. The breakfast is wonderful, enough to start your day. Elevator fits 2 people with luggage, or 4 without which is nice to find in Paris. Staff is friendly, helpful and speaks good English. Location is great, across from Metro station, walking distance to Latin Quarter, restuarants all around. Would certainly recommend to anyone visiting Paris for the first time. Will certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “an amazing, perfect experience, i will return soon!”
Reviews.Author: Maz017
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and loved every minute. The room was very spacious, wonderful view of Cafe de Flore and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was wonderful in a very relaxed environment. The service was excellent and very friendly. The location is walking distance to all major attractions and the area of St. Germain des Pres has a very relaxed and safe feel to it. The hotel's atmosphere is so relaxing and i can't wait to plan my next trip. Shuttle can be organised from CDG airport direct to hotel for a very reasonable price. Wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in best part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: julianmoseley
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in St Germain for years, usually round corner in Rue des Saintes Peres. However this was even better and quite immaculate and very comfortable. The location is amazing, directly opposite les Deux Magots & Cafe de Flore. And the Metro is across the street. I worry about writing this review as no doubt next time I won't be able to get a room. Fabulous little Parisian hotel. Well done Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French stay”
Reviews.Author: Careysue
Reviews.Content: Intimate, meticulously clean, hotelnrun by delightful locals. Rooms that could accommodate our family of three. Loved the bathrooms and the beds, linens, and all the amenities. The Breakfasts was awesome with the best coffee. Really a grate experience and value. This isn't over the top luxe but a well priced value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: seatrekker
Reviews.Content: After marrying in Scotland we continued our honeymoon in Paris. We were very pleased with this hotel. My father is a Best Western Gold Crown Club Elite Member and we used his points for our entire 4 night stay. Check in was easy and our room was as requested. It is located right near some very famous cafes and is a short walk to many sights and museums! The front desk staff was very helpful with booking tours for us and finding us a shuttle back to the airport. We really liked the boutique "feel" of this hotel and enjoyed the complimentary breakfast each morning. There is a taxi stand right in front of the hotel, so getting around was very easy! We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec. 7 to Dec. 11th and enjoyed every minute of it. The location is terrific and convenient to everything....metro right down the street and a ton of places to eat in the area and shopping all around. Our room was directly on Blvd. Saint Germain and looked right across at Deux Magots and Cafe Flore. We were there the day it snowed alot and we had a great view from our room. Our deluxe king room was spacious for european standards and the bathroom was also spacious and well equipped. Everything was spotlessly clean. The included breakfast is plentiful and very tasty......I wish I could have those delicious flaky crossaints delivered to my door every morning...yum ! The staff is spectacular....very helpful and accommodating and super nice. This was our 5th stay in Paris and this is so far my favorite hotel. I would highly reecommend this hotel...you won't be disappointed. I certainly hope we will return soon. Thank you Hotel Au Manoir Saint Germain and Bonne annee to everyone !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: stella9940
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two weeks at Au Manoir in November - we are well traveled and know what to look for. This hotel is perfectly located in the Left Bank area of Paris, and is in walking distance of the main places you'd want to visit. Metro just outside for when you want to go further afield. After the first few days of hectic "trying to see everything", we settled into the life of the area, and just enjoyed ourselves. This hotel is lovely in every way - the decor is immaculate, the rooms large for European standards, and the bathroom was great, with a shower to die for. Like standing under a waterfall. The breakfast is served downstairs, it is a buffet style with optional cooked extras...everything was tasty and fresh, and the croissants - perfect ! The staff went out of their way to help us, and everyone was friendly and pleasant. They made us feel welcome and comfortable. This is not the cheapest hotel you will ever stay at, but you will have wonderful memories of its ambiance, comfort and elegance for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and much more.”
Reviews.Author: sallywho0
Reviews.Content: For two weeks, late October and early November, this charming property was to my husband and me. Being a former travel professional, I know what to look for, what is important and not important, and so forth. Au Manoir surpassed even my picky expectations! Our room overlooking the Boulevard was not only beautifully decorated, it was thoughtfully designed for our comfort and convenience as well. Before booking, we asked about traffic noise. We were assured "no problem," there are double pane windows. That was true! Traffic noise doesn't penetrate these large windows at all. All the employees, at every level, were gracious and helpful, always pleasant. At breakfast, the variety of offerings iincluded the best croissants in the city. And, talk about location! Don't look any further! It is worth what you will pay. In six months, you may not recall the exact price, but you will always have the memory of a pleasant stay, with no hassles, in beautiful surroundings. This is simply the best! For all these reasons, I assure you, without any reservations whatsoever, you will be very happy at Au Manoir Saint Germain des Pres.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: manosel
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. The metro station is opossite the hotel. The breakfast was good. The room was big for Paris hotel. It was very clean. Everything was ok. It could be a little bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: unc66
Reviews.Content: Great location in St. Germain des Pres. Nice hotel, very nice staff, clean, reasonably priced, for Paris. Very near Metro, Les Deux Magots, the Church, zillions of restaurants, and Ralph Lauren's Paris store and others for the big spenders/fashion nuts. The hotel is not ostentatious, but very nice and convenient in a fun area with a helpful staff. recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: mexaholic
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based upon a very old Karen Brown recommendation, and since it doesn't get "perfect" marks on Trip Advisor we weren't sure what to expect, especially with the Best Western affiliation. Having just spent 5 nights there we can assure everyone that this hotel is a little gem. As others have said it's very well located, we could walk virtually everywhere -- which was especially good because of the strikes while we were there! The deluxe room we had wasn't large, but it was attractive, fresh and clean, nicely appointed, and actually had windows that opened. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is plentiful, with a good selection for a Continental breakfast. What really makes this hotel worth all those euros is the friendly and helpful staff. We rarely learn the names of the staff in a hotel, most are very impersonal, but here Aziz and Libania were standouts. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: BDL999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good location near great cafes and bus access to the major tourist hotspots. The room was spacious for Paris and everything was clean and well maintained. The bed was quite comfortable and it was pretty quiet even though in a busy area. The breakfast was very good and the staff were friendly and helpful. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara48
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for the last 8 years when i come to Paris. I have always thought it a good value for money. They have a friendly, helpful staff. That being said I would not go to them for restaurant reservations. I always come with my own list and they graciously make the reservations for me when I email them and confirm them when i arrive. This year when we left for the airport it was raining and fashion week so they had to really work to get us a taxi . However, they came through for us. It is things like this that make me a repeat client. Even my husband, the hotel snob, thought this was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimki2
Reviews.Content: The Room: was small, but I didn't choose a room in St. Germain for the size of the hotel room. It was clean, but needed to be dusted (the shelf inside the closet especially). The shower and sink area were clean and well appointed (although, I didn't see a shower curtain). The water closet was very small and really could use a brighter light. - if you have "overdone" it at all in Paris and need to spend anymore than 2 minutes in the w.c., it gets a bit dismal. The Hotel: was small but quaint. The included breakfast buffett was just enough to get your day started and the room was pleasant. The Staff: were incredibly warm and helpful. They all went out of their way to help us make decisions on tours and restaurants. They didn't "put on airs". They were friendly and really helpful. I would stay at this hotel again based soley on my experience with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, TINY bathrooms, front desk was clueless”
Reviews.Author: montgomerygrimes
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the location, right in the middle of the Paris tourist attractions. But even that was a mixed bag -- there was more English than French being spoken on the streets, it seemed! As hotels go, I wasn't impressed. The rooms were small. The bathrooms were *incredibly* small -- my wife and I couldn't even both leave our toiletry kits in the bathroom at the same time! Perhaps worst of all, the hotel simply refused to turn the A/C on in the hotel the first two nights we were there, and we both slept poorly because it was so hot. It was quite a relief when they finally relented on the third night! The elevator was tiny, slow and inconvenient. There was no one available to help us with our baggage. Breakfast was included, but fairly minimal. Finally, the front desk, while *appearing* to be helpful, gave us very little good advice. The restaurant they recommended seemed overpriced. The chocolatier they recommended had long since closed. They didn't know about getting tickets to the Eiffel Tower in advance. Etc. Very friendly, just not very knoweldgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Well Managed Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYMom0714
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and myself very much enjoyed our four night stay at your hotel. Rooms were a good size and very clean! The hotel breakfast was very enjoyable and quite convenient in the morning. The young lady at the front desk offered terrific restaurant ideas. The Hotel maintenance staff was polite and very nice. The manager, stephan, was so kind to us and assisted me when when my daughter became ill. We are very grateful to you and your staff. Many thanks. NYC mom and daughter

Reviews.Title: “Love the Au Manoir, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: raftingman
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at this hotel after a week on a houseboat in the south of France. Location: This location is amazing. Luxembourg gardens nearby for relaxing, tons of cafes, restaurants, and shopping, and very convenient for a hardy walk to the Louvre and other major attractions. Bonus, there is a "Monoprixe" around the corner, a "Target" type store with amazign groceries and fresh food for snacks and picnics. Rooms: Large, modern and with great bathrooms. Breakfast: Typical continental fresh breakfast. Bread, yogurt, coffee, etc. Great to have it included. Wifi: No free wifi, but you can use the lobby computer for free and get free internet in room with a cable. Service: Average. The front desk staff was a bit aloof and did not "go out of their way" to help. Example: I asked for a car service to the airport for 4 and they gave me a shared shuttle with a bunch of other people for more money that I could have paid for a private. Another example: there was a nearby street festival and staff knew nothing about it. Another: I booked two adjacent rooms and e-mailed in advance to confirm. When I arrived, we got two rooms separated by the elevator. Not adjacent. Bottom line: This is a great fairly priced hotel for Paris, where hotels are very expensive. The location can't be beat and the rooms are modern and spacious. Can't imagine a better deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, generous complimentary breakfast and comfy rooms made our stay in Paris easy.”
Reviews.Author: LBJoyride
Reviews.Content: Friendly English-speaking staff at front desk. Hi-speed internet is free and accessible. Walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, and for strolling on the Left Bank. The bed was heavenly after a long day of sightseeing. We felt completely at home.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive experience”
Reviews.Author: leevidaga
Reviews.Content: Since my family of 4 was staying in Paris for 2 full days/3 nights, I booked this hotel as we have stayed there on 3 separate occasions, and know the neighborhood well. If our stay were longer, I would not pick this hotel, because you are paying enormously for the location. And it couldn't be more convenient. Metro stop nearby, lots of shopping on Rue de Rennes and Rue de Sevres, restaurants and cafes too many to choose from. Since being taken over by Best Western, the hotel has been renovated. The bathrooms are fantastic, towel warmers and rain forest shower, and the decoration still very nice in the small-ish rooms. But it has lost a bit of the charm of the French tuile drapes that used to grace every room. Breakfast very generous with the best spot in the sitting area in the little atrium and overlooking "garden". Our family had to take 2 rooms as there are no family rooms. As I said, anything longer, I would go elsewhere. Another complaint: no free Wi-Fi despite the price.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good price - good size room”
Reviews.Author: oregontraveler97229
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this property. This was a great location. because of all the notes about how small the rooms are we booked a king size bed and had a small sitting room with twin bed/couch and the bathroom had been updated very nicely. breakfast was basic continental but plenty. I would definatley stay here again. our room was quiet despite being on a busy street. It was also Airconditioned which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location with Charm”
Reviews.Author: MayTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Au Manoir, (December 2009, June 2010), one of 4 "charm hotels" owned by one family. I also tried sister hotels Left Bank and Chambiges in October and March, but found this one the most suitable for my business and leisure needs and budget. As a solo female traveler who does not speak French, I enjoy the charming rooms, lovely reception staff and maid services, and lovely breakfast (included) at all 3 hotels. I found Au Manoir has the best view (Blvd St. Germain and L'Eglise St. Germain) that gave one a very needed sense of space to someone who is in meetings most of the day while in Paris. I have stayed in the 16th, 8th, 5th, and 6th and find the 6th to be the most charming. Sometimes the church bells ring, summoning one to mass and transporting one back to the village life of medieval times. Riding the 63 bus, very convenient to the hotel, provides one as well with a free view, day and night, of most of the major sites of Paris (Louvre, Concorde, Grand Palais, National Assembly, Eiffel Tower). The subway is just across the street. Notre Dame is a 15-20 minute stroll away. I really enjoyed the Christmas Markets at both St. Germain and St. Sulpice (4 blocks away), especially the crepes and vin chaud after a snowy stroll. The same fair-booths were erected during my June stay for the "Solidays" events. While I found the famous cafes immediately adjacent (Lipp, Flore, Deux Magots) to be great for people watching from my hotel room, I chose to walk down to Rue de Seine/Rue Buci for different dining experiences. The recent World Cup matches made for a lively evening experience for the business traveler, especially during the France/Mexico match. In all, staying at the hotel makes one feel as if they live in the (very nice) local environment, and helps raise my opinion of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot staff great”
Reviews.Author: JefeArdrossanAB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 14 nights on our vacation. It was by far a great hotel and the staff we very helpful. They biiked all our tours for us and advised us on when to go and not to go because of the crowds. the breakfast was good and it was all we needed to start the day. The supermarket is 5 mi away which was handy for snacks and drinks. the spots to eat around the hotel are huge. Watch the prices check the menu out side before you go in, I learned the hard way. Our faviort was the Italian spot La Locanda around the corner 5 min away. The food was great and not a bad price. We went on the night dinner cruise, payed a bit extra for a table for 2 but was wirth it. Normandy was a long but important day. The beaches is something everyone should see. All in all we enjoyed Paris and the hotel helped make it a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: CHF007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights - Great location, Staff very helpful. Very good breakfast in delightful rooms. Will stay again while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best small hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LarryBethune
Reviews.Content: I booked Au Manoir online; we all know this can be risky. This time, we found a gem. We liked everything about this place. We had just come from staying at the Hotel de Crillon on Place de Concorde in paris, a five-star hotel. We don't feel we missed a beat. A smaller hotel but the management and staff gave us the same level of service as the Crillon. The room was clean (the shower was great!), and the entire premises was beautiful. My favorite part was our window looked right across the Boulevard St. Germain and onto the Cafe de Flore and Cafe Deux Magots, where my heros Hemingway, Picasso, Sartre, Camus, and many others used to frequent. We will be staying at Au Manoir every time we visit Paris, that is for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ncflgal
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfu find Au Manoir is!!! You couldn't ask for a better location, and the staff was ever so helpful. We stayed on the top floor, and though the room was small, it was very romantic and cozy. Our only thoughts to make it even better would be: another mirror in the room, and perhaps automatic bucket of ice each day, late in the afternoon...this might just be an American hang-up, we need our ice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Week”
Reviews.Author: drmjb
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a great area, near several cafes and convenient to mass transit but it is also walking distance to many sites. The room was nice and clean, bath a little small but not a problem. On check in we were told the room requested on the 4th floor was a smoking room and we did request non smoking. We were given a non smoking room on the 3rd floor but this was obviously a smoking room only with a non smoking sign on the door. The smell took a few days to dissipate after opening the windows. We were offered another room but with no guarantee that people did not smoke in them. Other than this the hotel and room were nice, the breakfast simple but good and was served until 11:00 AM which on a few days was convenient. Internet in room was slow to nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation, helpful staff and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: MaryA60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two separate occasions during the month of May. We were both very pleased with the accommodations. They serve a very good breakfast in the morning which is included in the hotel's price.Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side , especially the bathroom, but they were impecable so the size becomes secondary. The staff was very good, specially a young lady that went out of her way to please us. The location was the best, walking distance to all the great places to visit. We would not hesitate to stay there again, and actually, we are already thinking about returning.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel which has everything - we felt very safe here”
Reviews.Author: Suepercyjewellery
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not cheap, it's worth every penny. The location is superb and we always feel safe when we stay here. (We are two ladies who love to shop whilst leaving our husbands at home). The staff are very warm and friendly and are always exceptionally helpful. The refurb has made this hotel an ideal place to spend a few days or a few weeks and as if it couldn't get any better the shops around Au Manoir are wonderful with the new Ralph Lauren flagship and restaurant about 8 doors away. I'm already saving for next year. Sue from Cardiff

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent and welcoming hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: sophieStockbridge
Reviews.Content: We had meant to stay in Paris for only two nights but got stranded with the icelandic volcano. The staff of Au Manoir were gracious and accommodating as well as good-natured in their interactions with the many anxious travelers in the hotel. They let us keep our room for the next week even though we didn't know from day to day when we would be able to fly out; and they offered much help with dinner reservations, directions, and google maps. The rooms are small but very comfortable with good beds and well-appointed bathrooms. And the buffet breakfast is excellent with some of the tables being set up in a bright garden room. The location of Au Manoir coudn't be better. It's right across the street from the Cafe Deux Magots and is in walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre, Gare d'Orsay, and Luxembourg Gardens. Although the hotel is on the busy Boulevard Saint Germain, double-paned windows adequately soundproof the rooms. We ended up having an unexpected and delightful week in Paris and send many thanks to the staff at Au Manoir.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Oliver2022
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through the internet. We had paid for in advance a SUPERIOR room. When we arrived we were given a standard room on the top floor overlooking the air con units. When we complained we were told that we could have a better room at an extra cost!!! After a phone call to our internet agent we were then given a superior room at the pre arranged price. We felt that the manager / owner was trying his luck to give us a standard room and sell the superior room we had booked. I would not recomend this hotel as there are many other hotels in the area that were the same price. I will never use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Euroshopper
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the level of help we received from Aziz and Libania at the front desk...before and after we arrived at the hotel. They went beyond the call of duty. They booked dinner reservations several times for us..,They were Incredibly nice and english speaking. We had room #502 it was very large with a nice view. We did not have any problem with noise although we looked right out on St Germain de Pres.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: NorthernTraveller209
Reviews.Content: We had a great time!. The hotel was very clean, staff were very friendly, location was superb. We will go back to this hotel for sure. K & M from Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cali63024
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until we left, 7 days, our stay was wonderful. The room was clean, and quiet and spacious. We had upgraded prior to the trip, to make sure the room was adiquite. Breakfast was good. The staff spoke English, which helped us. When help was required, a dental emergency on Saturday, the staff found us help. The location, for us, was perfect. Small shops and restaurants were plentiful. We will stay at the Hotel again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: I tend to pick my hotels from top of the list in TA, but this time the location/price combination was not a perfect match for me. After resorting to an old Charming Hotels in Paris book I came across this hotel. I could not believe it ever existed, as it is located EXACTLY at my favorite crossroads in Paris, and I had never noticed it. Indeed, it is just a small door next to Brasserie Lipp. I was afraid as I arrived as the lobby didn't quite live up to the room pictures (I don't think it had the uplift that they had in the rooms), but a warm reception from Aziz and the updated lift dispelled the first impression. The room was absolutely like in the pictures, bed extremely comfortable, and furnishings visibly updated from the bathroom to the carpets, drapes and appliances. Thank god, not those dreadful red carpets from turn of the (last!) century and curtain fabric bed covers so common in would be classy Parisian hotels. The room was extremely clean, too. However, it was the view from my two windows, that looked on to the cafes on St Germain boulevard and the Church that really conquered my heart. That was really everything I could wish for!!! and unlike other guests, I didn't hear any noise from the streets, and had great sleep on all nights I spent there. Breakfast was plentiful, although they don't try to compete (maybe rightfully so) with the neighboring cafes, so you get filter coffee and little option of cooked meals, but remember it is included in the room price, a rarity in Paris. My only negative comment, as already mentioned in one of the earliest reviews, is that they still need to raise the 4 star level to the bathroom toiletries, which had a really poor selection. This hotel doesn't claim to be a boutique hotel, so don't expect evening turndown or honesty bars. This is a very well located, solid old school hotel, with friendly service (once again thank Aziz and Liberia at reception) and nicely appointed rooms. This will remain my top choice anytime I come back to Paris, and a prime alternative for anyone who loves St Germain and the Latin Quarter. And hurry up, as it is still priced lower than other hotels in the region with similar or (mostly) worse quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: 26travelfam
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, in the most convenient location. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and fit an extra bed comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: natasha_wanderer
Reviews.Content: Considering Parisian hotel standards, this Best Western can be qualified as one of the best to chose from. Perfect location (quartier Saint Germain de Prés) in a lively neighborhood housing lots of shops (fashion for the most) and cosy cafés and restaurants. Small but very comfortable rooms (no noise to be heard from the streets), clean bathrooms (recently renovated) and a friendly service. Breakfast providing the usual: cereal, bread, eggs, cheese, hot and cold beverages,... Perfect for a short stay in Paris with a partner or family.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: wanderingdesi
Reviews.Content: stayed in room# 103 for 4 nights...it was all good until about 10:58 p.m. everynight when we would start hearing loud karaoke music from the other side of the wall...this would continue until 2:30 a.m. every single night... other than getting no sleep on my stay, the hotel is overall a good place to stay...great location, many things near by...open air food market, good bakery etc etc...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dohertys53
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for three nights. Loved the location. Room was clean and spacious and the beds were comfortable. There was a towel warmer in the bathroom that was great for laundry. The toiletries were a little lacking. Only soap and some bathgel/shampoo. Bring your own conditioner and body lotion. Pre-paid our room on the internet web special but still owed 17 euro when we checked out "for taxes". I plan to stay here again. 25 minute taxi to Orly. P.S Don't eat at the Tavern de St. Germain next door. Lots of good restaurants/cafes nearby. Grocery store is at 79 rue de Seine.

Reviews.Title: “WOONDERFUL HOTEL EXCELLENT STAFF FIVE STAR ALL THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: Saunders2607
Reviews.Content: Having spent some time researching where to stay found this hotel and reviews seemed good so booked and am so glad we did. Room was excellent, surprisingly spacious with king size bed and all amenities in a back room. Staff were wonderful, helpful in every possible way. Breakfast was excellent. Having left hotel after two days found ourselves back there again as Eurostar had cancelled all trains due to snow and a train stuck in tunnel. What a nightmare hours in the freezing cold railway station with no notifications of what was happening.. I do not recommend Eurostar -No communication and atrocious service, hundreds waiting with no information as to what was happening for hours on end. We rang this hotel and received a very warm welcome back and stayed here another night and were able to book a flight to london the next day on BA at great expense. Our room this time overlooked the busy street which was great for people watching, a smaller room and a little noiser as the taxi rank is right outside and people catching taxis all hours of the night! The monoprix to the right around the corner(inside the store and down the stairs to a supermarket) a godsend with cheap drinks and alcohol and an absolutely wonderful deli, fresh fruit and bread and a grocery store. Would highly recomemment this hotel and its wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised and more”
Reviews.Author: eloisetarkington
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 stayed here for the last 3 nights of 2009. Each of the 3 rooms we had were spacious, clean, and well accommodated. Loved the modern bathroom, especially the rain shower. We were pleasantly surprised to find a mini-fridge in each room. The front desk staff, cleaning staff, and dining room staff were always quick to offer a "bon jour", and were helpful with area info questions. The breakfast buffet provided a wide variety of selections - cereals, pastries, yogurts, fruit, cheeses, cold cuts, juices, and hot drinks. The dining area was comfortable, and the place settings were adorably french. The #4 metro line is diagonally across from the hotel, but most typical tourist sites are within walking distance. We even walked back to the hotel from the Eiffel Tower on New Year's Eve. The only complaint we had was that there was a lot of noise in the middle of the night from the shared courtyard. Not sure if this was typical or not since I haven't seen this in any of the other reviews. All in all I'd stay here again and recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: tedban
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with two other couples. Loved the area, proximity to metro, walking to Siene and around neighborhood. Room was very comfortable, bathroom was first class. Attendant/concierge was very helpful and friendly. Loved our dinner at neaby L'Entrecote steak house-- unique place. Hotel was quite reasonable, and would stay again without any second thoughts!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: Colleen_travelqu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in November. We like to stay on the Left Bank because of all the restaurants, bistros, and feeling of being in a community. We have stayed the past 10 years in a hotel several blocks away that we love, but decided to try this hotel as the previous hotel hadn't been refurbished in years. We were pleasantly surprised and will now call this hotel "home". We stayed in one of the "deluxe king" rooms and felt it to be worth the extra money. It was large and the bathroom was very large and modern. There are only 28 rooms in the hotel. The rooms at the front are more bright and sunny, but the rooms at the back are more quiet. There was no wifi, but they did give us a cable to hook up to the internet. The morning breakfast was excellent and included in the price of the room. Front desk was very nice and helpful. Location was outstanding. It is located across the street from Cafe Flora and Deux Maggots, but if you go there just have a glass of wine. We found the prices of these two places have gone out of sight and the quality of food and service had gone totally downhill. We had profiteroles one night at Cafe Flora and it was awful. The little bistro next to the hotel - I think it was Tavern St. Germain had good food and excellent mussels. We will definitely stay here again. For those that don't have a laptop there is a computer with internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, stylish room in best location...”
Reviews.Author: FussyTravellerH
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris once a month for work and usually stay around St Germain area. This is the first time I stayed in this hotel and can't wait to stay there next time. Its chic and stylish, perfectly Parisian! The staff are all very friendly and helpful. You cannot beat the location, the metro is directly across the road, lots of great restaurants, bars and fantastic shops. It is perfect for soaking up the French ambience...

Reviews.Title: “Will come back for xmas”
Reviews.Author: DereckO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about a week while on a business trip. It wasn't my first stay in paris but defo first time I stayed on the left bank. I really liked the surroundings -particularly rue du bucy & rue mazarine. The hotel has it's own style which is kind of unusual for a business stay but that also made me think I'd like to come back with my girlfriend as I now know the area. Only thing I would have wished for is a spa or a fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Our preferred hotel on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: D_JL_R
Reviews.Content: The Au Manoir Saint Germain de Pres is our preferred hotel on the left bank of Paris due to its location & the friendly & helpful staff. Since the recent renovations, the rooms have spacious bathrooms with modern facilities. We prefer rooms facing Boulevade Saint Germain that are quiet but provide an excellent outlook of the cafes & catherdral. The Metro & bus are at the corner for easy access to other parts of Paris & Saint Germain de Pres has excellent restaurants & shopping within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jane5California
Reviews.Content: After researching tripadvisior and Karen Brown's recomendations we booked this hotel. We were able to book a phenomenal web rate on the hotel's website. The hotel is in a great location, we had a memorable dinner on our last night at Des Maggot, and we easily walked to the Seine, and easily used public transportation. I would recommend this hotel, it is a nice boutique style hotel, which is what we like. The breakfast was perfect in the sitting room and all the staff was graciousl

Reviews.Title: “Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: HenryVI
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to pick a better location - a neighborhood rich in tourist attractions, shops, restaurants - and easy access to all modes of ground transportation. The hotel itself is small and you quickly get to know the staff and vice versa and that staff is friendly and efficient. The rooms are bigger than average for Paris and they're attractive and well organized. Modern bathroom. Wi-fi. Excellent breakfast. Well priced for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Paris as you picture it”
Reviews.Author: Canuck_Explor
Reviews.Content: Experience Paris as you picture it. The essence of a memorable Paris Vacation is being located in a quaint location which is easily accessible to all the tourist attractions. The Best Western Premier Au Manoir Saint Germain De Pres is located in the Beautiful St. Germain district which is only a short walk from Notre Dame, and a short Metro ride from all the other attractions of Paris. The Metro is very close by and offers an easy way to get around the city. The St. Germain area gives you the true feeling of Paris peppered with many quaint “Paris” Style cafes and restaurants all within a short walking distance, and all very family friendly. The Hotel is a real find, aside from the great location; the rooms are not a bad size for Paris, very clean, and bright with a nice view of the cutest little Café. The staff are very friendly and always willing to help with directions or suggestions. The service was always great, and the breakfast is very nice. Definitely worth considering!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: LondonPoolite
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of 'trendy' Paris then this is a place for you. The rooms are not massive but for the heart of Paris they nicely done and are a good size. Surrounded by designer shops, designer cafes/restaurants and designer people. We sat in Cafe de Flo late one night for a digestive (directly opposite the hotel) and Karl Largerfeld turned up and ate there !!! Pretentious moi ? That might not impress some people but my girlfriend was amazed, and that is why you go to Paris, right ? It is also easy to get anywhere from St Germain du Pres and all of this is reflected in the local prices. Honestly you'll pay through the nose staying in this area but the hotel is immaculately clean, the staff are very accommodating and if you can get room 602 you'll have a nice terrace to sit on, which is free. Luxembourg Gardens is also only a short walk away if you run out of cash.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AngusEdmonton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we expected. The room was attractively appointed and provided us with a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. The hotel staff was effecient and helpul. We also appreciated the breakfast that was provided and the room. The garden next to our table was a very fine touch. This hotel is with in walking distance of many of the sites that we wanted to see. Highly recommended by my wife and me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: must-keep-moving
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Paris and, of the 3 hotels, this is the one I'll recommend to friends. Lovely and safe neighborhood, very nice room, convenient to Metro, lots of restaurants (head to the right as you leave the hotel for a good selection of some less expensive ones). Appreciated the mini-fridge, which we stocked with drinks from the Monoprix around the corner (Monoprix has a grocery in the back of the basement where you can pick up a 6-pack of water for under a euro; the front of the basement has a large section of prepared foods you could picnic with). Hotel staff helpful, spoke English well. We appreciated the fresh fruits at breakfast and the free internet hookup in room (we brought our own computer).

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: eleviv
Reviews.Content: We've stayed many places in Paris but this is our new favorite place. Loved the neighborhood feel of this gem on the Left Bank. The rooms were very fresh, clean, quiet and were an oasis after long days of immersing ourselves in Paris. The staff was most accomodating and helpful. We've recommended it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean small hotel”
Reviews.Author: acdalian
Reviews.Content: very good small clean hotel in fantastic location. although right on st germain blvd, noise ie not an issue. from room 402 can people watch till past midnight! metro is steps away, monoprix is round the corner. excellent coffe, croissants for breakfast, which is included. front desk especially ursula helpful. good food abounds, try le parisien for lunch, le petit zinc, and tavern st germain.my 6 4 and 6 year olds ate chocolate crepes from the guy in front of st germain metro every day!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: davidsuzykai
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after doing lots of cross referencing from books, this site and other sites. When we arrived at 12.30pm with our 3yo we were told our room would be ready in 45 mins, after 2 1/2 hours we finally got into our room and were very happy with what we had chosen. The rooms are beutifully renovated and spacious in Paris terms, new bathroom, sofa and seperate toilet, LCD TV A/C and nice tonings and of course FREE internet in your room with your own laptop . The hotel is in a great location with lots of restaurants and cafe's on the doorstep and we just walked back from the "Arc de Triomphe" and the "champs elysees" and walking casually it took us 50 mins but it is a nice walk. The tour bus that is a hop on hop of bus that goes to all major sites has a pick up point only a hundred meters or so away so you can access all of Paris for the day for only29 euro. Downsides to this hotel is the small B/Fast area and tiny lift and the parking if you have a car is across the street at 25euro a day other than that it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LuvJerseyShore
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was a wonderful find in Paris. I looked at many hotels online before choosing Best Western Premier Au Manoir Saint Germain Des Pres and was very happy about our decision. I visited in April 2009 over Easter holidayswith my son. It is very cozy, rooms are smallish by American standards (good-sized by Paris standards), full bath tub, comfortable beds. We faced the inner courtyard and had very quiet nights. It is within walking distance of three separate metro lines, one being right across the street. You are a short walk (10-15 minutes) to the Louvre, the Orsay, and a number of other sights in the 5th and 6th arrondisments. Good restaurants nearby and right across the street and next door to three of the most famous of Paris' cafes. (We did not visit ourselves but did people watch when we walked by.) Breakfast offered by hotel was very good, the staff was friendly and accomodating to our requests and got to know my son's desire for scrambled eggs each morning. I would certainly go back as the location cannot be beat. I booked directly through the US-based Best Western internet site and was able to get a great rate. Thanks for the wonderful vacation and I hope to be back soon as there is so much more to see in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “A spacious room in Paris?”
Reviews.Author: cinnysim
Reviews.Content: Yes...my daughter and I were quite surprised. The hotel has apparently been recently refurbished and our room was bright, airy and included not only two twin beds but also a lounge chair and desk. AND...an overhead shower in the bath! Strongly recommend...the location is great...the metro is across the street and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: tolittlefish
Reviews.Content: This 3-star or 4-star hotel is well suited in the Saint German des pres area, a very good desirable area. According to the hotel website, it was recently remodeled. Location is close to everything and major sight seeing tourist spot. BNP Paribas ATM (for those BOFA customers, no ATM withdrawal fees) is right down the street, less than 1 minute walking. Metro entrance right in front of the ATM machine. Grocery supermarket RIGHT NEXT DOOR (turn right at the hotel's immediate corner, take the escalator down in a fashion clothing store. It's a well hidden market!). One pastry store few steps away, another one down the street. Good size room and bathroom. Room has a sofa, a recliner, in-room safe, 2 bath robes and 2 slippers. Bathub is bathroom is very deep. There is a pocket door you can slide out from the wall. It seperates the washing area and the sleeping area. The toilet is a seperate powder room. Continental breakfast has good variety. We had a promotional refundable, cancelable rate of 160 Euro which is acceptable. If you can book early and pay in advance, the nonrefundable rate can be found for less than 140 Euro a night, which is definitely a STEAL. Full rate is 300 Euro a night. Hotel is loated on a main street. Although our room was by the elevator, the window did not face the steet, so we hardly heard any noise from the steet, nor the noise from the elevator. We hopped 3 hotels within a week, this is my favorite hotel among the 3.

Reviews.Title: “Is it time to go back yet?!?”
Reviews.Author: redroofrack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dream; the location is perfect; the staff is helpful; the breakfasts are wonderful. Go there now!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at a Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Laiane
Reviews.Content: I was a little disconcerted reading the reviews written prior to the hotel's renovation in 2008. This was the first online reservation I'd done for a Paris hotel. I am so glad that we choose Au Manoir! My husband and I had a quiet, courtyard room (Room 305) which, by Parisian hotel room standards, was quite large. My husband is 6'5", so finding a room to fit him was an issue! Au Manoir was exceptionally clean and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful (even the poor soul running the check-in at 1:00 a.m. when we arrived, and subsequently interrupted twice more as we settled in to the room). The "free continental breakfast" was served buffet style, and included Nutella, jams and jellies, honey, pastries, bread, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. -- and you could go back for seconds. Juice and eggs were available for a small fee for those who wanted them. Highly recommended. I would definitely come back to stay on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: Lucy2foru
Reviews.Content: I went for the last Ready to Wear collections. And I really enjoyed this hotel. The Parisian decoration and the bathroom are very nice, the location is perfect. But there is more. Is he the Manager? I remember is name his Stephane. He was very helpful, And by the the way, he is cute! I will return. See you then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice space in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: StalkerF1
Reviews.Content: Small lovely hotel representing Old French Style just in two steps from Sorbonna, Louvre and Notre Dame. Quiet place to have good rest and taste Paris way of life.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great price”
Reviews.Author: LV23
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location or the price of this hotel in Paris. I will definitely be back. The hotel has a lift, unlike some Paris hotels, which made getting our bags upstairs very easy. The beds were comfortable and breakfast was included. The breakfast buffet was very good considering it was included in the price of the room. The bathroom could have been cleaner. The location, however, can't be beat. You can walk to everything in Paris from this spot and what you can't walk to you can get to by the metro which is located right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Under renovation until June 2008”
Reviews.Author: lindasp62
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in Paris is under renovation....Yes, the rooms were a bit on the small side, but the staff and the location cannot be beat. But, the whole hotel and rooms are under renovation until June 2008, even enlarging the smallest rooms (they heard us!!). Keep in mind that everything is on the small side in Europe, but I know that this hotel will really pull it off to open to the great hotel that it is once renovated. See http://hotelaumanoirsaint.free.fr/ (no, I do not work for this hotel, just a traveler who stays here each time I visit Paris)

Reviews.Title: “not that good at all”
Reviews.Author: zara168
Reviews.Content: Been there 1 night only, 4 stars are not for the hotel itself, but for the location, as i spoke with the guy on the front desk and he told me.I had to ask for a cattle, they did gave me one, but even hotels 2 stars have cattles in the rooms, the key didnt fit the fridge, the room was small, view in some poor yeard, all the hotel is like in the end of the 19 century, but kind of creapy and scary. Breakfast not bad,but not the money they ask for anyway.Toilet the smallest i have ever seen, shower old and not good.Beds ok, but the 3th was unusable anyway. Not recomending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: vtucker103
Reviews.Content: This is a two star hotel in four star web clothing. We had booked three nights based on the location, Best Western affiliation and web photos. From our arrival via taxi (who didn't have change for a 50 euro bill in the middle of the day) to the front desk person (who also didn't have change for a hotel guest checking in) it was all down hill. In the room which we were given we couldn't shower and my husband couldn't shave because both drains were stopped up. The desk person went up to check and said "they were just a little slow and nothing could be done anyway because it was the weekend". The two rooms we saw were both threadbare and not well maintained; the standard room was the size of a small walk-in closet. We stayed the night and the only good thing they did was send us to a lovely three star hotel less than a block away. There are lots of excellent hotel choices in Paris; this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: VMac
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights in this hotel. We had room 602 on the top floor overlooking Boulevard St Germain and it was fantastic. The room was a good size and the double glazing shut out any noise from the street below. We had requested a room at the front but saw into room 603 and although it faced the back of the hotel it had a small balcony. Breakfast was fine but I was disappointed that the fruit was not fresh but tinned. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Flea”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters6
Reviews.Content: Beware the glossy pictures. Although at one time charmingly decorated, the decor is now over a decade old, and beginning to show it. Our party booked 3 rooms on the 4th floor, and one of them was already inhabited by fleas. By the end of a 3 night stay its occupant looked like she'd contracted chickenpox. Service was average - some staff more pleasant than others. One decidedly offhand, but this is typical of French hospitality in my experience. On the plus side it's in a fantastic location with plenty of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: cbish777
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in early June and found the hotel a good value due to the size of the room, the cleanliness and the great location (paid 166 Euros/night for a queen). Our room was a decent size, especially compared to other hotels in the area where we have previously stayed and where we had so little space that we had trouble walking around the room, the bed here was comfortable and the bathroom modern. I would suggest asking for one of the two front rooms on each floor (we were happy with room 101 and saw that 102 is even bigger and nicer--both rooms overlook the busy street and have big double windows that open so you can get fresh air and hear the sounds of Paris). I think 201 and 202, and 301 and 302 would have the same basic layout (realize that room 101 is actually on the 2nd floor, since 0 floor is the ground level). And, best of all, when the windows were closed, the room was quiet! There is a taxi stand in front and famous cafes across the street and next door, and we were not bothered by noise at all. I saw room 203 (expect that 103 and 303 would be similar) and it had a nice king bed but looks into a boring courtyard. Looking at the hotel floor plan, the remaining rooms (104, 105, and especially 106) seem like they would be smaller and also no view--I would much prefer the front rooms. It is a small hotel with about 18 rooms I think. We found we used the St. Germaine Metro station a lot, which was one block away, and we walked to the Louvre in about 10 minutes, plus you could walk to the Musee D'Orsay easily too. The breakfast included each morning was adequate, with slices of ham, cheeses, a basket of croissants and rolls, hard-boiled eggs, cereals, yogurt, orange juice, etc. in a nicely decorated dining area. There is a Monoprix store around the corner if you want to get some grocery items and we went there several times. The cafes are expensive but the food was good and you are paying to sit and watch the parade of Parisiennes and tourists who stroll by--we got used to 4 Euro Cokes and 6 Euro beer and 8-10 Euro drinks after a few days in Europe! The rooms are well-decorated and comfortable and I would stay there again. The staff was helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Mieky
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based upon its location which is fantastic, however the hotel website is very misleading as to the size of their rooms. They only advertise the large superior rooms. The hotel reception desk clerk was rude and unhelpful when I requested to be moved to a twin bedded room as per my booking. We were allocated a double room which was tiny, little storage, barely enough room for two suitcases. We were informed that there were no twin rooms available. There was a problem with the plumbing in our room, sounded like a bath running right above our heads. We complained in the early evening and no one came to see the problem. At 3:30am the noise was still going so we were moved to another room. We were booked into stay 1 more night but checked out vowing to never recommend this hotel to anyone. We were disapointed that the hotel manager didnt offer a discount, considering the problems we experienced during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Scott1946
Reviews.Content: My guest and I stayed here on August 3rd & 4th. The location is perfect, with famous cafes and not famous cafes (all wonderful) surrounding you and Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, and Luxembourg Gardens within an easy walk. Staff were very friendly and helpful (the proprietress even called up a concierge she knew in another hotel to find us the best seafood restaurant in the area), and the rooms had large comfortable beds and were roomy and air-conditioned. I was also able to get a favorable rate for the time of year. I WILL be coming back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NiceGuy6
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful! Me and my girlfriend, along with another couple we're friends with, stayed here for six nights and had a wonderful time. Our room was ready for us at 11am. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The afternoon/evening guy (I don't remember his name) was outstanding - he gave us many recommendations on where to eat and called them all to get us reservations; he was right, the places he recommended were amazing! Our room was small by American standards but not by European - it was very comfortable for both of us. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was also small but had a wonderful shower head that felt so good after a long day. The location is wonderful - it's right across the street from Cafe Les Deux Magots, which has the most amazing hot chocolate drink you'll ever have. There is also a bar/karoke club next door with a huge selection of beers (expensive, but very good). The hotel is very close to the subway, which is easy to use - buy the weekly pass! In summary - great place!

Reviews.Title: “rude reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was adequate but in need of refurb. Very clean. Very rude desk clerk, I think her name was Ursula. Because of her, would not stay there again. Much better choices for the price. I stayed there several years ago when it was a 2 star called the Tarenne. Owners ran it then and they were very nice. Rooms same size and amenities as far as I can remember but have been given some fancy wallpaper. Try the hotel de Seine on the Rue de Seine, 2 blocks up the street--much better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Au Manior Staint Germain De Pres”
Reviews.Author: lkn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, it was great! The regular double room, albiet, small..was very clean, the use of space was very good with cabinets above bed. Also..the bathroom was immaculate. What we liked best though, was the wonderful staff, who went the 'extra mile' for us. Location was perfect would definitely return again. PS breakfast was very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a well appointed hotel with quiet and efficient service. The location is excellent with east walking to Metro, museums, great restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly and unobtrusive. Breakfast was excellent. Everything is clean and everything works! Breakfast was terrific. I wish I could get coffee like that at home. We will definitely return on our next trip to Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Au Manoir Saint Germain De Pres
HotelInfo.Address: 153 Boulevard Saint Germain | 6th Arr., 75006 Paris, France
